DataElement.preferredName: World Health Organization Classification Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia Category World Health Organization
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Leukemia with an acute onset, characterized by the presence of lymphoblasts in the bone marrow and the peripheral blood. It includes the acute B lymphoblastic leukemia and acute T lymphoblastic leukemia.A United Nations agency established to coordinate international health activities and to help governments improve health services.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A United Nations agency established to coordinate international health activities and to help governments improve health services._A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A United Nations agency established to coordinate international health activities and to help governments improve health services.

Concepts.definition: A United Nations agency established to coordinate international health activities and to help governments improve health services.

Property.preferredDefinition: Classification; the grouping of things into classes or categories.

Concepts.definition: A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia Category World Health Organization
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Leukemia with an acute onset, characterized by the presence of lymphoblasts in the bone marrow and the peripheral blood. It includes the acute B lymphoblastic leukemia and acute T lymphoblastic leukemia._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics._A United Nations agency established to coordinate international health activities and to help governments improve health services.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Mixed Phenotype Acute Leukemia, Rare Types
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A very rare mixed phenotype acute leukemia in which the blasts express combinations of B, T, myeloid, and megakaryocytic lineage markers but are negative for KMT2A rearrangement and t(9;22)(q34;q11.2) translocation. The prognosis is usually unfavorable.

Concepts.longName: Mixed Phenotype Acute Leukemia, Rare Types
Concepts.definition: A very rare mixed phenotype acute leukemia in which the blasts express combinations of B, T, myeloid, and megakaryocytic lineage markers but are negative for KMT2A rearrangement and t(9;22)(q34;q11.2) translocation. The prognosis is usually unfavorable.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.9.5 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002816. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A rare mixed phenotype acute leukemia in which the blasts express T-lymphoid and myeloid lineage markers but are negative for KMT2A rearrangement and t(9;22)(q34;q11.2) translocation. The prognosis is usually unfavorable.

Concepts.definition: A rare mixed phenotype acute leukemia in which the blasts express T-lymphoid and myeloid lineage markers but are negative for KMT2A rearrangement and t(9;22)(q34;q11.2) translocation. The prognosis is usually unfavorable.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.9.5 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002816. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredName: B Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia with ZNF384 Rearrangement
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: B-acute lymphoblastic leukemia associated with ZNF384 gene rearrangement. The prognosis is variable.

Concepts.longName: B Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia with ZNF384 Rearrangement
Concepts.definition: B-acute lymphoblastic leukemia associated with ZNF384 gene rearrangement. The prognosis is variable.

PermissibleValues.value: Mixed phenotype acute leukemia (MPAL) with t(9;22)(q34.1;q11.2); BCR-ABL1
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Mixed phenotype acute leukemia (MPAL) with t(9;22)(q34.1;q11.2); BCR-ABL1

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Mixed Phenotype Acute Leukemia with KMT2A Rearrangement
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A rare mixed phenotype acute leukemia in which the blasts carry a translocation between the KMT2A gene at 11q23.3 and another gene partner. The prognosis is usually unfavorable.

Concepts.longName: Mixed Phenotype Acute Leukemia with KMT2A Rearrangement
Concepts.definition: A rare mixed phenotype acute leukemia in which the blasts carry a translocation between the KMT2A gene at 11q23.3 and another gene partner. The prognosis is usually unfavorable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The most frequent type of acute lymphoblastic leukemia.  Approximately 75% of cases occur in children under six years of age.  This is a good prognosis leukemia.  In the pediatric age group the complete remission rate is approximately 95% and the disease free survival rate is 70%.  Approximately 80% of children appear to be cured.  In the adult age group the complete remission rate is 60-85%.  (WHO, 2001)

Concepts.definition: The most frequent type of acute lymphoblastic leukemia.  Approximately 75% of cases occur in children under six years of age.  This is a good prognosis leukemia.  In the pediatric age group the complete remission rate is approximately 95% and the disease free survival rate is 70%.  Approximately 80% of children appear to be cured.  In the adult age group the complete remission rate is 60-85%.  (WHO, 2001)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Acute lymphoblastic leukemia of T-cell origin.  It comprises about 15% of childhood cases and 25% of adult cases.  It is more common in males than females.  (WHO, 2001)

Concepts.definition: Acute lymphoblastic leukemia of T-cell origin.  It comprises about 15% of childhood cases and 25% of adult cases.  It is more common in males than females.  (WHO, 2001)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Mixed Phenotype Acute Leukemia, B/T, Not Otherwise Specified
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A very rare mixed phenotype acute leukemia, not otherwise specified in which the blasts show clear-cut evidence of both B-cell and T-cell lineage. (WHO 2017)

Concepts.definition: A very rare mixed phenotype acute leukemia in which the blasts show clear-cut evidence of both B-cell and T-cell lineage but are negative for KMT2A rearrangement and t(9;22)(q34;q11.2) translocation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).
